To all parents ... Info from the CAFETERIA about lunches. In an effort to reduce contact, the cafeteria lines will be cashless to the greatest extent possible. Online payment is encouraged. If online payment is not possible, checks can be sent to the district.

Elementary Students may also bring in cash or checks in sealed envelopes with their name and teacher name on it to be deposited.

At the secondary level, if students bring cash, any change will be applied to the student account. In the event a student must have change back, we will take steps to accommodate that request.

Due to the national coin shortage and the effort to reduce touch points, maintaining our typical service level with change may be difficult.

We will make every effort to care for individual needs.

Thank you for understanding, we appreciate your help with this request.

Stay safe everyone!

Today's senior in the spotlight...JT Campbell!

Plans for the fall: Attend the University of Pittsburgh at Bradford for Exercise Science

Interests: Baseball, Soccer

Memories of PCS: Winning Spud Bowl sophomore year, Hitting my first varsity homerun junior year

Shout out: Thank you H-Dogg! Coach Groff, thank you for stepping in as a great soccer coach and building a relationship with us players the past two years. Coach Putnam, thank you for always pushing me to become better. Coach Hahn, my first varsity coach, thank you for giving me a chance.

JT has been a critical part of the PCS Baseball program for 4 years. He has played many positions including 3rd base, outfield, and some innings on the mound. His Jr. year he hit in the middle of the line-up and was counted on to drive in runs. JT loves the game of baseball, and his passion for the game shows in his work ethic. JT is a pleasure to coach, and a good teammate. I was looking forward to JT’s senior season, as we had a good core group and we were looking to make a deep sectional run. -Coach Brian Putnam
